column2: FLORIDA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. A __________ marks the right edge of the roadway.
2. Your license must be revoked if you:
column4: are found guilty of 15 offenses for which you receive points within a 5-year period.
column6: fail to carry insurance on your vehicle.
column8: fail to stop for a school bus.
column10: you refuse to take a DUI test.

column2: 3. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 4. You should use a three-point turn:
column4: on a curve, to turn your car around in a very small space.
column6: when you miss an exit  on a highway.
column8: on a hill, if the road is clear.
column10: only if the road is too narrow for a U-turn and you can’t go around the block.

column2: 5. Which of the following must be avoided when passing another vehicle:
column4: On a two-lane road, blinking your headlights to let the other driver know you are passing.
column6: Returning to the right side of the road immediately after passing the other vehicle.
column8: Giving your signal before you move into the left lane.
column10: Checking blind spots to make sure that you have plenty of room to pass.

column2: 6. Passing a stopped school bus will result in __ points being added.
7. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
8. The red car turning left must:
column4: yield to pedestrians and traffic before turning.
column6: proceed with caution even if it has the right-of-way.
column8: turn left before the oncoming car gets too close.

column2: 9. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
10. A driver needing to turn a car around in a very small space should:
column8: use a three-point U-turn on a curve.

column2: 11. Roads are most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 12. When you see a cyclist approaching at night, you should NOT:
13. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column6: slow down and enter the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 14. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.

column2: 15. Driving during restricted hours will result in __ points being added.
16. On a three-lane expressway, drivers should use the ____ lane for passing.
17. Racing on the highway:
column4: is only allowed if you drive at least 5 MPH below the posted speed limit.
column10: is allowed only if the highway is empty and you are completely sober.

column2: 18. Which shape is used to give advance warning of no passing zones?
19. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column6: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column8: be ready to brake sharply and stop.

column2: 20. When there is a green arrow pointing left, and the red light is illuminated at the same time, drivers:
column4: must stop if they are in the green arrow lane.
column6: should come to a complete stop if they can. The green light will soon be red.
column8: have the right-of-way and can turn left from any lane.
column10: must be in the proper lane to make a turn in the direction of the arrow, and must yield the right-of-way to vehicles and pedestrians.

column2: 21. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
22. The picture shows:
23. When the posted speed limit is 70 MPH, the minimum speed limit is:
column6: There is no minimum speed limit, it is always safe to drive slowly.

column2: 24. Total stopping distance is:
column4: the sum of reflex distance, preparation distance and braking distance.
column8: the total minimum distance a vehicle has traveled until the driver can bring it to a complete stop.
column10: the sum of yielding distance and braking distance.

column2: 25. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column6: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column10: Drivers should walk more and drive less.

column2: 26. Which of the following is NOT true? When entering an open intersection, drivers must yield the right-of-way if:
column4: they enter or cross a state highway from a secondary road.
column6: they are already in the intersection.
column8: they enter a paved road from an unpaved road.

column2: 27. The Florida “standard” speed limit in business or residential areas is:
28. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
29. The average perception time for an alert driver is:
30. Which way should you turn your wheels when parking facing uphill where there is a curb?
31. When a person under the age of 18 is not restrained by a safety belt or a child restraint device, a seat belt violation will be charged to:
32. When you approach this sign, you must:
column8: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 33. This sign means:
34. When drivers see this road sign:
column6: they must not drive past this sign.
column8: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column10: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.

column2: 35. Your license must be revoked if you are found guilty of ___ cases of reckless driving within one year.
36. The center lane of a three-lane or five-lane highway is used only:
column4: when it is safe to pass and passing is allowed.

column2: 37. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
38. Which of the following is NOT a rule for safe driving:
column4: Ask your doctor how your medications affect driving.
column6: Do not drink alcohol between 9:00 a.m. and 2 p.m.

column2: 39. Restricted lanes are usually reserved for:
40. Where are pennant signs placed?
column4: On the right side of the road, facing the driver.
column8: Where a highway is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: On the left side of the road, facing the driver.
